name: Moroccan Merguez
ingredients: 1 kg of lamb meat with its fat (800g of meat, 200g of fat minimum)
1 tablespoon of harissa (more if you like it spicy)
1 tablespoon of smoked paprika (or Chipotle chili powder)
steps: Grind the meat and fat (if not done by the butcher) using a meat grinder (large 12mm plate).

Place the ground meat in a large dish. Sprinkle all the spices (garlic, harissa, oil, fennel, paprika, cumin, salt, pepper, coriander, parsley). Mix everything by hand until you get a homogeneous stuffing.
Let rest for 2 hours in the fridge (to allow the flavors to develop).
Soak the casings in warm water (unless using collagen casings).
Stuff the mixture into the casings using a funnel (or the meat grinder attachment). Do not overstuff.
Pinch and twist the casing to form sausages of the desired size.
Let the merguez dry for a few hours. Cook on the grill, in a pan, or on a barbecue.
